attributes.action: Legislate to promote a fair and transparent credit market in the UK which will protect consumers and their rights in the credit market, regulate all credit providers, debt counselors and credit bureaus, limit the cost of credit and level the playing fields between credit providers
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Banks and lenders in the UK have unprecedented control over the rates charged for borrowing and we hear daily storied of citizens being charged exorbitant rates that have no bearing on the base or any other rate and this is causing extraordinary hardship for many citizens.
 
We the undersigned propose that Legislation be introduced to:

(i) introduce strict limits and rules about the amount of fees and the cost of charges consumers should pay on borrowing via facilities such as home loans, credit cards* and bank overdrafts, and
(ii) Establish a National Credit Regulator responsible for the regulation of the UK credit industry. 
(iii) Establish a National Consumer Tribunal to adjudicate matters relating to the proposed legislation.

We urge the Government to follow the example of South Africa where The National Credit Act was introduced in 2007 and was designed to provide consumers with more safeguards in terms of credit – the loans and borrowing they take out. Search Google "ncr consumer booklet" for more details.

*For example:  Credit card rates should be limited to a maximum of: base rate x 2.2 plus 10%
